etymology.description: 师(teacher; master) + 傅(tutor; instructor) = respectful title for a skilled master/worker
etymology.interpretation: Combines two near-synonyms for instructor, reinforcing respect and authority. In modern usage it’s a polite form of address for skilled tradespeople, drivers, and craft masters.
etymology.simplification: 師 was simplified to 师 by reducing strokes for ease of writing; 傅 remained unchanged. Intuition: high-frequency title streamlined for quicker handwriting while preserving meaning.

examples.chinese: 师傅，请帮我修车(師傅，請幫我修車)。
examples.pinyin: Shīfu, qǐng bāng wǒ xiū chē.
examples.english: Master, please help me fix the car.

examples.chinese: 这位木工师傅手艺很好(這位木工師傅手藝很好)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè wèi mùgōng shīfu shǒuyì hěn hǎo.

examples.chinese: 出租车师傅熟悉这条路(出租車師傅熟悉這條路)。
examples.pinyin: Chūzūchē shīfu shúxī zhè tiáo lù.
examples.english: The taxi driver knows this road well.
